author: Special Correspondent
text:
EC has sought its assistance

In an effort to check the influence of money power in the election process towards the May 16 Assembly polls, the Investigation Directorate of the Income Tax (IT) Department has joined efforts to discover and seize unaccounted funds within Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

Toll-free number

The Director General of Income Tax (Investigation) in charge of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry has set up a round-the-clock control room with toll free number 18004256669 and designated fax number 044-28278799 to receive complaints and information.

An official release from the office of the Director General of Income Tax (Investigation) for Tamil Nadu and Puducherry stated that the Election Commission of Indian had sought its assistance. The role of the Directorate was to provide assistance for free and fair elections in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry by controlling the role of unaccounted funds in the election process, it stated.

“Persons who have knowledge/information about storage, possession or movement of large amount of cash are requested to pass on the information through any one of the above modes,” the release by Additional Director of Income Tax (Investigation) V. Roy Jose, Nodal Officer, Election Expenditure Monitoring stated.

E-mails with complaints or information could be sent to itcontrol.chn@gov.in

Random vehicle checks

The officials of the Election Commission-constituted Static Surveillance Teams and Flying Squads have been conducting random vehicular checks and have been confiscating cash, liquor bottles, gifts and other items from individuals who do not carry supporting documents.
